item.title: Russia hates on the Olympic Games, relishing 'scandals' and controversy in Paris
item.description: Russia's media has shunned coverage of the Olympic Games in Paris ‚Äî unless something has been controversial or gone wrong.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield rises to 3.94%, back to Friday's levels
item.description: Treasury yields were higher Wednesday as global markets reversed course from Monday's equity sell-off.

item.description: For the first time in more than two years, Disney's media assets are outshining the parks division.

item.title: Putin accuses Ukraine of 'large-scale provocation' at the Russian border
item.description: Russia President Vladimir Putin accused Ukraine on Wednesday of carrying out what he called "yet another large-scale provocation" at the Russian border.

item.title: The Fed appears to have finally created the recession it wanted
item.description: U.S. central bank engineers an economic slowdown whenever unemployment is low and the president is a Democrat.

item.title: Uber reports better-than-expected earnings and revenue for second quarter
item.description: Uber reported earnings and revenue that topped estimates for its second quarter.

item.title: Oil prices lifted as data shows drop in U.S. crude inventories
item.description: Oil futures rose Wednesday, finding support as the stock market continued its recovery from a global rout that had served to pull down commodity prices.

item.title: Nearly half of student loan borrowers are expecting debt forgiveness, Sallie Mae report finds
item.description: Nearly half of student loan borrowers are anticipating debt forgiveness in the future. Here's how that might happen.

item.title: Hamas' new political leader Yahya Sinwar is seen as more extreme ‚Äî and less willing to compromise
item.description: Haniyeh's killing has led to a much more hardline leader for Hamas, likely dealing a severe blow to chances of a cease-fire.
